intro: Parathesis oaxacana, commonly known as the Oaxaca parathesis, is a species of flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Oaxaca, Mexico. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in well-drained soils and thrives in temperate to subtropical climates. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and are often dispersed by wind or animals. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
